data.title: 160 Years – Around the Ground – Virtual Experience this weekend – Lowerhouse Cricket Club
data.text:
In our post yesterday, we talked through the History of the Club and the club legend Tommy Shutt.

This is Lowerhouse Cricket Clubs 160th year in existence – we wanted to mark the occasion, with an interactive experience so that people, whilst on the ground can see what it looked like in yesteryear!

This weekend on Sunday, at our home game against Greenmount, you’ll be able to find 5 QR codes. These located on each side of the ground, if you open the camera on your phone and scan the QR code, it will show you a number of photos from that angle in previous years over our 160 year history.

There is also an interactive map below, where you can scan the QR codes and check out the photos, if you can’t get down to the ground in person.
